bioghist.p: Dr. Jean Sutherland Boggs (born 1922) has been an active and vital participant as a scholar and administrator in the fine arts community in Canada and the United States for more than half a century. Serving as the first woman director of the National Gallery of Canada from 1966-1976, she taught art history as a professor at Harvard University from 1976-1979. A distinguished art historian, Boggs has published extensively on the life and work of Edgar Degas and organized several exhibitions on the artistâ€™s work, receiving international recognition for her scholarship. Following her precedent-making appointment in Canada, Boggs became the first woman Director of the Philadelphia Museum of Art. She served from March 1979 to June 30, 1982, then left to become Chairman of the Canada Museums Construction Corporation in Ottawa.

scopecontent.p: The Jean Sutherland Boggs Records consist of general correspondence and Museum subjects. There is only one series. Divided by fiscal year, with each year in alphabetical order, consisting of names and subjects.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
